Enabling this setting empowers you to ta: Enabling this setting allows you to control the loyalty rewards system precisely by defining the percentage of the cashback amount that customers can earn with each purchase across all your locations. You can tailor the percentage in a way that supports your goals, whether it's to incentivise frequent purchases, promote certain products, or increase customer loyalty.
Choose how much Loyalty customers earn a: Choose how much loyalty cashback amount customers earn as a percentage of each sale at your locations.
With this percentage, a customer will ea: For example, with this percentage a customer will earn
Loyalty on a SAR 100.00 sale: loyalty cashback on a bill of SAR100.00
This would be the minimum amount in the: The minimum amount required in a customer's loyalty wallet to redeem. A customer would be able to redeem while transacting at your location after verifying through OTP.
You will lose access and customers won't: If a loyalty program is disabled, customers may not have the ability to gain or redeem the loyalty cash during that period. However, their existing details and cash will be retained in the system and will become accessible for use once the loyalty program is re-enabled. It's important to communicate this process clearly to customers to ensure they understand that while the program might be inactive for a period, their accrued benefits will not be lost and will be available again once the program is reinstated.

po description: Generate a Purchase Order (PO) to your chosen vendor for the necessary products, specifying the required quantities and agreed-upon prices. You may proceed to receive the inventory from the main list once the PO is created.
grn description: If you haven't generated a purchase order, don't worry! You can receive incoming stock from a vendor without having a specific purchase order
You can not add more than 50 Quick Items: You can not add more than 50 Quick Items
You can see the inventory history of the: You can only see the inventory history of the products that has inventory management enabled
Info net cost: The overall expense for acquiring the product is determined during the purchase. The system computes the average cost price of a product by considering the cost of stock received during the chosen period. In instances where there is no stock received in the specified period, the system takes into account the predefined cost price excluding VAT.
Info net profit: The final amount that remains after subtracting net cost from net sales. This does not include the taxes.
Info net margin: The percentage of net profit relative to net sales. This does not include the taxes.
Refund an be initiated from POS: Coming soon! Currently the refund can be initiated from POS
Historys of the company can be managed h: Histories of the company can be managed here
Info vendor average fulfilment: The average number of days it takes the vendor to fulfill or complete the delivery of items after receiving a purchase order.
Info average shipping: The average number of days it takes for the vendor to ship goods after receiving a purchase order
Info order date: Date on which the order is placed
Info expected date: The anticipated date on which the vendor is expected to deliver the goods.
Info delivery date: The date on which the vendor delivered the goods.
Info potential revenue: Considering the total sales that could be achieved if all available units of a particular product are sold at their respective prices.
Info potential profit: Considering the potential revenue and subtracting the associated costs.
Info margin: Profit margin represents the percentage of profit earned from the sale of a product.
This is an approx. value based on the co: This is an approx. value based on the cost defined excluding any actual expenses to arrive at COGS.
Info inventory report: A summary of your company's inventory, automatically generated daily at midnight.
Please relaunch the 'Tijarah360 POS' app: Please relaunch the 'Tijarah360 POS' app on all the POS devices for the changes to take effect.
Product updated successfully, it will t: The product has been updated successfully. It may take a few minutes for the changes to be visible on the POS, provided the POS is currently online. Alternatively, the update will be reflected in the product list once the POS comes back online.
Product created successfully, it will t: The product has been updated successfully. It may take a few minutes for the changes to be visible on the POS, provided the POS is currently online. Alternatively, the update will be reflected in the product list once the POS comes back online.
info total categories: The statistical information for categories and products is obtained from sales data. This is not the exact count of products and categories in your catalog.
info top performing category: The statistics are determined by the number of sales and not the revenue.
info total products: The statistical information for products and categories is obtained from sales data. This is not the exact count of products and categories in your catalog.
info top performing product: The statistics are determined by the number of sales and not the revenue.
Info gross sale: Sales amount after discounts and refunds, including VAT.
Info balance amount: The total sales amount following any refunds and discounts.
Info total sales: The total sales amount following any refunds and discounts.
Expiring product info message in invento: Expiring product info message in inventory dashboard
Special characters, alphabets and spaces: Special characters, alphabets and spaces are not allowed. Only numeric values are allowed.
The product's cost price is automaticall: The price of the product can be indicated in this section. The product's cost is automatically computed with each new stock arrival, and the entered value will be adjusted to reflect the updated average cost of the product corresponding to each stock intake.

Info VAT report cost price: This is a provisional amount defined based on certain listed factors. The cost per piece for acquiring the product is determined during the purchase. The system computes the average cost price of a product by considering the cost of stock received during the chosen period. In instances where no stock is received in the specified period, the system considers the predefined cost price. This includes VAT.
Info VAT report VAT on purchase: This is a provisional amount. The calculation of VAT paid to vendors is derived from the product's cost price and the quantity sold.
Info VAT report VAT on sale: VAT on total sales after any discounts and refunds
Info VAT report Total VAT Amount Payable: This is a provisional figure. VAT payment is determined after considering the variance between VAT on purchases and VAT on sales. This is just for reference. Please calculate as per actuals

The system computes the average cost price of a product by considering the cost of stock received during the chosen period. credit_enabled_msg_for_merchant_account: Activate this to allow customers to purchase on credit. Set terms and limits based on trustworthiness and history.
msg_default_customer_credit_setting_for_: Establish a standard credit amount accessible to new customers by default. Keeping this off will disable credit functionality for a newly added customer.
max_credit_limit_message_per_customer_fo: Define the highest credit amount a customer can be granted.
Allowed to change the credit limit at cu: Allowed to change the credit limit at customer level beyond company default?
max_credit_percent_message_at_customer_l: Adjust this setting to specify the percentage by which a customer's credit limit can exceed the default amount.
disable_credit_alert_msg_for_merchant_ac: Turning off the credit feature will stop any new credit transactions for customers. However, customers can still settle any outstanding balances even after the credit option is disabled.

info_msg_for_allow_credit_customer_scree: Use this button to enable or disable the option to extend credit to a customer. When enabled, it allows the selected customer to make purchases on credit, to be paid at a late stage. When disabled, the customer must settle payments upfront with other payment modes for any transactions.
message_max_credit_for_customer_screen: Specify the highest amount of credit a customer can utilize.
msg_for_blocked_credit_customer_screen: Use this button to temporarily block a customer, preventing any future transactions.
msg_for_blacklist_credit_customer_screen: Blacklist a customer to prevent future transactions due to non-payment, fraud, or policy breaches.

The day-end report covers transactions w: The day-end report covers transactions within store hours, like 8 AM to 10 PM. If the system doesn't follow these hours, it ignores any POS day-start and day-end actions.
The report relies on custom day start an: The report relies on custom day-start and day-end events, allowing flexible hours. If the day-end isn't performed, the system extends reporting to cover all transactions until the next day, aggregating multiple starts and ends.
The reporting period extends to cover al: The reporting period extends to cover all transactions until the actual closing time, even if it surpasses predefined business hours, continuing until the next business day or shift.
If the pos is not doing the day end it w: If the pos is not doing the day end it will be automatically done at the specified day-end time.
The report follows the standard calendar: The report follows the standard calendar day from 12 AM to 11:59 PM, aligning with the conventional daily timeline. The system ignores any day-start and day-end actions performed from the POS.
The report covers a rolling 24-hour peri: The report covers a rolling 24-hour period from a set start time, like 6 AM to 5:59 AM the next day. The system ignores day-start and day-end actions performed from the POS
